thread.title: Notorious yellow car vandalised in picturesque village
thread.title_full: Notorious yellow car vandalised in picturesque village | West Country - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Notorious yellow car vandalised in picturesque village
text:
An "ugly" bright yellow car blamed for ruining the view in one of the country's most picturesque villages has been targeted by vandals.
The car belongs to a local widower. Credit: ITV West Country The word "move" has been scratched into the bonnet of the Vauxhall Corsa, which is parked outside a 14th century cottage in the Cotswold village of Bibury.
The driver's side window and rear windscreen were also smashed.
Owner Peter Maddox became the source of some controversy in 2015 when visitors complained that the car was wrecking the classic English scenery.
The retired dentist insisted he had nowhere else to park and continued leaving his car on the road - until it was vandalised.
Sorry, this content isn't available on your device.
£6,000 estimated repair costs including respary The costs of the repairs could make the car a write-off.
But, the 84 year old says that if it turns out to be too expensive to repair, he would buy a replacement - in lime green.
Peter is understandably upset at the loss of his car and his independence, but he is also very fond of his lovely yellow car.
Everyone in the village is very supportive. It is horrible to think whoever has done this has come out of their way down this little road to do something like this.
– Marie Kraus, daughter-in-law Credit: ITV West Country Many villagers say they are "disgusted" by the crime.
We have conducted house to house inquiries. We are aware that presence of the vehicle was the bone of contention to some people.
Nevertheless the damage caused to vehicle is beyond the pale and we would appeal for anyone who knows anything to contact us.
– Sergeant Garrett Gloyne yellow car Bibury
